alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; McCormick (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 9:26PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Edgefield and southeastern McCormick Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 926 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clarks Hill Recreation Area, or 9 miles north of Evans. This storm was nearly stationary. ...Boaters on Lake Strom Thurmond Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarks Hill Recreation Area, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Hamilton Branch State Park, Modoc Boat Ramp, Modoc, Clarks Hill, Colliers, Forks Campground, Lost Wilderness Fire Station, Scott`s Landing, Fury`s Ferry Boat Ramp and Modoc Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Lake Thurmond, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
